questions.description: Which part of the world has a high density of organisms:

options.description: Species richness increased with increasing explored area but only upto a limit
Extinction rate of species increases with increased area

questions.description: MAB stands for:
Which of the following feature(s) should be shown by a stable community:

options.description: Resistant to invasion of alien species

questions.description: Ethical argument for conserving biodiversity relates to the:

options.description: Countless direct economic benefits from nature
Need to realize that every species has an intrinsic value
Aesthetic pleasures of walking through thick woods

questions.description: Where are Hot Spots of biodiversity in India:

options.description: Indo-Burma, Eastern Ghats and Sri Lanka, Himalayas
Western Ghats & Sri Lanka, Indo-Burma and Himalayas

questions.description: Strict protection of biodiversity hotspots could reduce ongoing mass extinctions by almost:

options.description: Increased biodiversity contributed to lower productivity
Loss of key species imposes major threat to ecosystem health

options.description: Many of these cannot be cultured in the lab

questions.description: Which of the following statements is wrong?

options.description: A stable community should show much variation in productivity year to year

Rich biodiversity is essential for ecosystem health and imperative for the survival of the human race on this planet

options.description: Increased variability in certain ecosystem processes

options.description: Prevention of poaching in protected forests

questions.description: Which of the following group represents minimum species diversity among vertebrates:
We should care about loss in biodiversity in the populations of other species because of:

options.description: Potential loss of medicinal plants and other products yet undiscovered from threatened species
Potential loss of genes, some of which may code for proteins useful to humans
The risk of global ecological instability
All of the above options are correct

questions.description: Agricultural lands frequently require nutrient augmentation because:

options.description: Cultivation of agricultural land inhibits the decomposition of organic matter
Land that is available for agriculture tends to be nutrient poor
The nutrient that become the biomass of plants are not cycled back to the soil on lands where they are harvested
Nitrogen fixing bacteria are not as plentiful in agricultural soils because of the use of pesticides

options.description: Species of taxonomically different groups occur in almost equal abundance
Species of taxonomically same group occur in almost equal abundance
Species of taxonomically different groups occur in unequal proportion
Species of taxonomically same group occur in unequal proportion

questions.description: Select an incorrect statement w.r.t. biodiversity:

options.description: Mountain peaks are more diverse than foot hills
Valleys are more diverse than mountain peaks
Shade sides are more diverse than sun sides of mountains

questions.description: Conventional taxonomic methods are not suitable for identifying:

options.description: Tropical latitudes that have remained relatively constant since millions of years

Constant environments that promote niches specialization
More solar energy that is available in tropics results in less productivity

questions.description: Select the correct statement:

options.description: Heterogeneity exists only at the species level
India is divided into 25 biogeographical regions

questions.description: Broadly utilitarian argument for conserving biodiversity relates to the:

options.description: Aesthetic pleasures we derive from nature
